stance_1: I am curious about animal welfare
stance_2: I eat all types of meat
justification: A growing curiosity about animal welfare may conflict with eating all types of meat, as concerns about animal conditions could prompt reconsideration of meat consumption.

stance_1: I am curious about animal welfare
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Enjoyment of meat may come into conflict with curiosity about animal welfare if ethical concerns arise, but this tension is only emerging for the interviewee.

stance_1: I eat all types of meat
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: The enjoyment of the taste and texture of meat strongly supports the behavior of eating all types of meat.

stance_1: I eat all types of meat
stance_2: I grew up in a meat-eating household
justification: Growing up in a meat-eating household directly supports the current behavior of eating all types of meat.

stance_1: I eat all types of meat
justification: Understanding that pork is unhealthy somewhat conflicts with eating all types of meat, as the interviewee mentions possibly cutting back on pork.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of meat
stance_2: I grew up in a meat-eating household
justification: Growing up in a meat-eating household likely fostered enjoyment of the taste of meat.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Enjoyment of meat may conflict with understanding pork is unhealthy, but the evidence for this conflict is weak.
